data.title: Top Employer: Wilfrid Laurier University
data.meta_description: Wilfrid Laurier University has been chosen as one of: Southwestern Ontario's Top Employers, Waterloo Area's Top Employers, Canada's Greenest Employers, The Career Directory.
data.text:
Industry Post secondary schools, universities Established in Canada 1911 Major Canadian locations Yellowknife NT, Milton ON, Waterloo ON, Brantford ON, Kitchener ON Full-time employees in Canada 1,821 Part-time employees in Canada 749 Average age of employees in Canada 45 years Longest serving employee 51 years Flexible work options hybrid work option, flexible work hours, 35-hour work week (with full pay), compressed work week, shortened work week (fewer hours with less pay), telecommuting, reduced summer hours, earned days off program Long-term savings defined-benefit (DB) pension, defined-contribution (DC) pension Health plan premium as part of the health plan, the employer pays up to 100% of the premiums Mental health practitioner benefit up to $600 each year Maternity top-up (mothers) up to 95% of salary for 15 weeks Parental top-up (mothers) up to 95% of salary for 10 weeks Parental top-up (fathers) up to 95% of salary for 10 weeks Adoption top-up up to 95% of salary for 10 weeks Vacation allowance new employees receive 3 weeks of paid vacation after their first year on the job Outside survey period outside consultant surveys are held every 24 months Employee performance reviews employees receive individual performance reviews every 12 months In-house training initiatives in-house training, online training, mentoring, leadership development programs, paid internships Employee charitable involvement employees are involved in selection of charities, employees receive paid time off to volunteer, (up to 3 paid days)

action plan (includes a 40% greenhouse gas reduction target by 2030) Publishes sustainability report yes Green highlights Sustainable Hawk Fund (up $30,000 annually directed to sustainability projects led by students, faculty, staff and the community), offers a number of courses and academic programs focused on sustainability issues, Green Office Program (encourages staff and faculty to take part in campus sustainability initiatives), move-out program (includes a new Free Store program for exchanging gently used items and drop-off stations to collect items for donation including textbooks, furniture, clothing and non-perishable food), designated Fair Trade Campus, Zero Waste Week (includes informative games and activities), reducing single-use food containers in partnership with Friendlier (reusable food containers) Noteworthy initiatives formal certificate in sustainability that is open to employees and faculty and includes 8 sustainability workshops that cover a range of sustainability issues, from alternative transportation to recycling and reuse, Rain It In (annual competition for student teams to develop innovative stormwater management systems) Building footprint includes PV solar panels, rainwater collection, green roof, electric vehicle charging stations, solar air heating, water bottle refill stations, LED lighting, low-flow water fixtures, building waste heat recovery, HVAC retro-commissioning (new sub-metering with integration to a cloud-based dashboard) Extended recycling e-waste, batteries, organics, sale of plastic water bottles phased out in 2014, central waste management system Commuter amenities Region of Waterloo's TravelWise program (regional carpool matching program, along with discounted transit passes and emergency ride home
